docs.lead_paragraph: The Food and Drug Administration approved a second weight-loss drug on Tuesday after years of caution stemming from the heart damage caused by a drug used in the fen-phen diet pill combination.

headline.seo: F.D.A. Approves Qsymia, a Weight-Loss Drug
headline.main: F.D.A. Approves Qsymia, a Weight-Loss Drug
headline.print_headline: After 13-Year Drought, the F.D.A. Approves a Second Drug for Weight Loss

docs.abstract: Food and Drug Administration approves Qsymia weight loss drug, previously known as Qnexa, developed by Vivus; Qsymia is second weight-loss drug, after Belviq, to gain approval in the last month; no new prescription weight-loss drugs have been approved in 13 years, and options for the one-third of American adults who are obese were limited and rarely prescribed.
docs.snippet: The Food and Drug Administration approved a second weight-loss drug on Tuesday after years of caution stemming from the heart damage caused by a drug used in the fen-phen diet pill combination.

docs.lead_paragraph: Marissa Mayer has blazed several trails in Silicon Valley -- as Google's first woman engineer, as one of its most high-profile executives when she oversaw its search business and as a serious technologist who was also willing to show her feminine side. Now she will blaze a new trail, as a pregnant woman taking the helm of a major technology company.

headline.main: Yahoo Chief's Challenge? Corner Office, New Baby

docs.abstract: Yahoo's new chief executive Marissa Mayer is challenging the idea that senior executive ambitions and a woman's family life are conflicts of interest by tackling a difficult corporate technology job at a major public company while expecting a new baby. Photo (M)/
docs.snippet: Marissa Mayer has blazed several trails in Silicon Valley -- as Google's first woman engineer, as one of its most high-profile executives when she oversaw its search business and as a  serious technologist who was also willing to show her feminine...

headline.main: Yahoo Chief's s Challenge? Corner Office, New Baby.

docs.abstract: Despite Marissa Mayer's new job as chief executive of Yahoo, many barriers remain for women in Silicon Valley. But could her new job and pregnancy also be signs that a more progressive attitude toward women and work is taking root?
docs.snippet: Despite Marissa Mayer's new job as chief executive of Yahoo, many barriers remain for women in Silicon Valley. But could her new job and pregnancy also be signs that a more progressive attitude toward women and work is taking root?

docs.lead_paragraph: The air rifle competitor Nur Suryani Mohamed Taibi is set to join an exclusive club: just three other pregnant women are believed to have competed in the Olympics, all in the Winter Games.

headline.main: Pregnancy No Barrier to Malaysian’s Olympic Journey
headline.print_headline: Pregnancy No Barrier to Malaysian's Olympic Journey

docs.snippet: The air rifle competitor Nur Suryani Mohamed Taibi is set to join an exclusive club: just three other pregnant women are believed to have competed in the Olympics, all in the Winter Games.

headline.main: Marissa Mayer's Other Big New Job

docs.abstract: Balancing a new baby and a high-profile job may be more challenging than the new Yahoo chief executive’s blithe dismissal of the question suggests. But kudos to her and the company for wanting to make it work.
docs.snippet: Balancing a new baby and a high-profile job may be more challenging than the new Yahoo chief executive’s blithe dismissal of the question suggests. But kudos to her and the company for wanting to make it work.

headline.main: Yahoo Chief's Challenge? Corner Office, New Baby
headline.print_headline: Yahoo Chief’s Challenge? Corner Office, New Baby

docs.abstract: By tackling a difficult corporate job while pregnant, Marissa Mayer, the new chief of Yahoo, is challenging the idea that senior executive ambitions and a woman's family life don't mix.
docs.snippet: By tackling a difficult corporate job while pregnant, Marissa Mayer, the new chief of Yahoo, is challenging the idea that senior executive ambitions and a woman's family life don't mix.

docs.lead_paragraph: David Liu used to travel very cheaply, which could involve several layovers. Then a backer told him that no chief executive could afford to be an exhausted traveler.

headline.seo: How a CEO Came to Know First Class - Frequent Flier
headline.main: How a C.E.O. Came to Like First Class
headline.print_headline: How a C.E.O. Came to Like First Class

docs.abstract: Frequent Flier column features XO Group co-founder and chief executive David Liu discussing his flying experiences.
docs.snippet: David Liu used to travel very cheaply, which could involve several layovers. Then a backer told him that no chief executive could afford to be an exhausted traveler.

docs.lead_paragraph: A small fraction of the 17 million books, pamphlets, prints, and other memorabilia in the National Library of Medicine is rediscovered in a new book.

headline.seo: ‘Hidden Treasure’ at the National Library of Medicine
headline.main: Art and Artistry of Our Anatomy
headline.print_headline: Art and Artistry of Our Anatomy

docs.abstract: Dr Abigail Zuger reviews book Hidden Treasure: The National Library of Medicine, edited by Michael Sappol.
docs.snippet: A small fraction of the 17 million books, pamphlets, prints, and other memorabilia in the National Library of Medicine is rediscovered in a new book.

keywords.value: United States National Library of Medicine
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: Some are calling on fertility doctors to rely less on high doses of hormones to avoid serious complications, even if it means lower rates of success.

headline.seo: High Doses of Hormones Add to IVF Complications
headline.main: High Doses of Hormones Faulted in Fertility Care
headline.print_headline: High Doses of Hormones Faulted in Fertility Care

docs.abstract: Critics are calling on doctors to rely less on high doses of hormones in fertility treatments, to avoid serious complications such as ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome, even if it means lower pregnancy rates; fertility clinics in Europe and Japan have turned to a safer, low-dose form of in vitro fertilization, shift that has been resisted in the United States.
docs.snippet: Some are calling on fertility doctors to rely less on high doses of hormones to avoid serious complications, even if it means lower rates of success.

docs.lead_paragraph: Law enforcement efforts should not interfere with the right of anyone, including sex workers, to protect their health.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Megan McLemore, a senior researcher at Human Rights Watch, warns that police in several US cities regularly harass sex workers for carrying large numbers of condoms, using them as evidence to support arrests; contends that trend is causing some sex workers to engage in risky behavior, undoing the progress of condom-distribution programs and potentially increasing the spread of HIV.
docs.snippet: Law enforcement efforts should not interfere with the right of anyone, including sex workers, to protect their health.
